parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model, Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the physical examination can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the physical examination findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included collected on the Physical Examination CRF using the date (PEDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEPERF

fields.completionInstructions: If physical examination was performed as planned then select Yes, otherwise, select No.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned physical examination was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. Used to ask if the physical exam was performed at the overall subject level at the specified time point. If this field is used then the result should only be mapped to PESTAT if the overall examination, at the subject level, was not performed. If the overall examination was performed then the value of PESTAT would be null for each examined body systems and Not Done for any body systems not examined (see PERES).
fields.label: Physical Examination Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PESTAT. If PEPERF= "N" the value of PESTAT = "NOT DONE". If PEPERF = "Y", then the actual Physical exam results would be reported by body system (see PERES). PECAT, PESCAT, PETEST and PETESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. If used for an entire CRF or other set of multiple tests with PECAT and PESCAT, PETESTCD = PEALL.
fields.name: PEPERF
fields.questionText: Was the physical examination performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PECAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the physical examination category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor defined Controlled Terminology. The CRF can capture the different types of Physical Exams using PECAT (e.g. GENERAL, OPHTHAMOLOGIC, NEUROLOGICAL). This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PECAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.
fields.label: Category for Physical Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PECAT
fields.questionText: What was category of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PESCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the physical examination subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the PECAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. The CRF can capture the different subtypes of Physical Exams categories using PESCAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PESCAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. PESCAT can only be used if there is a PECAT and it must be a subcategorization of PECAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Physical Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PESCAT
fields.questionText: What was subcategory of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record complete date of examination using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date when the physical examination was performed represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of examination may be determined from the date of the visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: Date of Physical Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PEDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PETIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time of examination (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of examination represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.
fields.label: Time of Physical Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PETIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PESPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Physical Exam Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: PESPID
fields.questionText: What is the physical examination identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PETEST

fields.completionInstructions: Per protocol, perform physical examinations of specified body systems.
fields.definition: Name of the body system.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor should pre-populate CRF with all body systems to be examined. The use of a complete list of body systems eliminates the need for an other, specify category as any abnormalities identified should fall under one of the pre-specified categories. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Body System can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Body System Examined
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable PETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PETEST.
fields.name: PETEST
fields.questionText: What was the body system examined?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PERES

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the overall assessment for each exam category/body system listed.
fields.definition: Overall assessment of examined body system.
fields.implementationNotes: If the examined body system is normal then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC. When the SDTM-based datasets are created, PESTRESC is the standardized value for PEORRES and is populated for any record where PEORRES is not null. If the abnormal findings are coded using a dictionary, then PESTRESC should be the dictionary preferred term or if not coded PEORRES.
fields.label: Physical Exam Verbatim Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES = "Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES = "Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.
fields.name: PERES
fields.questionText: Were the results normal, abnormal or not done?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEDESC

fields.completionInstructions: Record all abnormal findings for the given body system in the space provided.
fields.definition: Text description of any abnormal findings.
fields.implementationNotes: If the examined body system is normal then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC.
fields.label: Physical Exam Abnormal Findings
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES = "Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES = "Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.
fields.name: PEDESC
fields.questionText: If the result was abnormal, what were the findings?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PECLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Was the physical examination result clinically significant? If Yes select Yes, otherwise, select No.
fields.definition: An indication whether the physical examination abnormality is clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: If this level of information is needed for reconciliation with adverse events, this field may be added to the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPE dataset as the value of SUPPPE.QVAL where SUPPPE.QNAM ="PECLSIG" and SUPPPE.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PECLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the physical examination result clinically significant?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEEVAL
fields.questionText: Who was the evaluator?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason the assessment was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures reason why the measurement or test was not done. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (for example, broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text.
fields.label: Physical Exam Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEREASND
fields.questionText: What is the reason that data was not collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEBODSYS

fields.definition: Body System or Organ Class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.
fields.implementationNotes: PEBODSYS should be assigned using a coding system. If included on the CRF, it is prepopulated and must be paired by the sponsor with specific pre-specified verbatim terms. If not included on the CRF, PEBODSYS is assigned through the coding process.
fields.label: Body System or Organ Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEBODSYS
fields.questionText: What is/was the [body system/ organ system]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEMODIFY

fields.definition: If the value for PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. PEMODIFY contains any modified text used for coding. Used only when the reported abnormalities in PEORRES are coded to a dictionary. This is in contrast to Events and Interventions domains where the topic variable (TERM or TRT) is modified for coding.
fields.label: Physical Exam Modified Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEMODIFY
fields.questionText: N/A

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PELOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of physical examination.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Location of Physical Exam Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PELOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PELAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PELAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEPORTOT

self.title: Physical Exam Location Portion or Totality

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the proportionality of the anatomical location of the of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method of test or examination.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.
fields.label: Physical Exam Method
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PEMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the test or examination?
